<line: 21> JUAN A. FERNANDEZ-BARQUIN, P.A. 
<line: 22> (FL. BAR NO. 055811) 
<line: 23> 3663 SW 8th Street Suite 200 
<line: 24> Miami, Florida 33135

<line: 26> Fax: (305)446-4498 
<line: 27> E-mail: juan@jafblaw.com 

[TITLE]
<line: 29> COMPLAINT AND DEMAND FOR JURY TRIAL 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> Plaintiff, POLLY MORLOCK, by and through undersigned counsel, hereby files this 
<line: 32> Complaint against Defendant CARNIVAL CORPORATION, a Panamanian corporation with its 
<line: 33> principal place of business in Florida, doing business as CARNIVAL CRUISE LINES, and 
<line: 34> alleges: 

[TITLE]
<line: 36> JURISDICTION, VENUE, AND PARTIES 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> 1. 
<line: 39> This is an action for damages in excess of seventy-five thousand ($75,000.00) dollars,  
<line: 40> exclusive of interests and costs. 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> 2. 
<line: 43> This court has jurisdiction based on diversity of the parties pursuant to 28 USC §1332. 
<line: 44> 3. 
<line: 45> Venue in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida is  

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:17-cv-22184-KMM   Document 1   Entered on FLSD Docket 06/09/2017   Page 2 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 4> appropriate pursuant to the forum selection clause contained in the ticket contract between 
<line: 5> Plaintiff and Defendant. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 4. 
<line: 8> At all times material, Plaintiff Polly Morlock, was and is a citizen and resident of and  
<line: 9> domiciled in the State of Michigan, and at all times material was a passenger on board 
<line: 10> Defendant’s vessel “Carnival Ecstasy” (hereinafter “Ecstasy”). 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 5. 
<line: 13> Defendant Carnival Corporation is a Panamanian corporation with its principal place of  
<line: 14> business in Miami, Miami-Dade County, Florida, and does business under the fictitious name of 
<line: 15> “Carnival Cruise Lines”. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 6. 
<line: 18> Upon information and belief, at all times material, Defendant Carnival Corporation,  
<line: 19> personally or through an agent: 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> a. 
<line: 22> Operated, conducted, engaged and/or carried on a business venture in the State of 
<line: 23> Florida, and in particular Miami-Dade County, Florida; 
<line: 24> b. 
<line: 25> Were engaged in substantial business activity in the State of Florida, and in 
<line: 26> particular, in Miami-Dade County, Florida; 
<line: 27> c. 
<line: 28> Committed one or more of the acts stated in Florida Statutes §48.081, 48.181, or 
<line: 29> 48.193. 
<line: 30> d. 
<line: 31> Operated vessels and provided for cruises in the waters of this State. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 7. 
<line: 34> All conditions precedent to the institution have been satisfied, or otherwise excused,  
<line: 35> including the pre-suit notice required by the terms and conditions of Defendant’s ticket contract. 

[TITLE]
<line: 37> COUNT I - NEGLIGENCE 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 8. 
<line: 40> On or about November 3, 2016, Defendant owned and operated the passenger cruise ship  
<line: 41> known as the “Carnival Ecstasy”. 

[TEXT]
<line: 43> 9. 
<line: 44> At such time and place, Plaintiff Polly Morlock was lawfully and legally aboard the  

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:17-cv-22184-KMM   Document 1   Entered on FLSD Docket 06/09/2017   Page 3 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 4> aforementioned vessel as an invitee and paying passenger with the actual and/or constructive 
<line: 5> consent of Defendant. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 10. 
<line: 8> On November 3, 2016, while on board the “Ecstasy”, which was operating in navigable  
<line: 9> waters, Plaintiff was seriously injured on a water slide when another passenger collided with 
<line: 10> Plaintiff, causing a myofascial concussion including contusions of the head and neck. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 11. 
<line: 13> At all times material hereto Defendant, Carnival Corporation, owed a duty to Plaintiff 
<line: 14> and other similarly situated passengers to exercise reasonable care under the circumstances. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 12. 
<line: 17> Defendant, Carnival Corporation, breached its duty owed to Plaintiff by committing one  
<line: 18> or more of the following acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> a. 
<line: 21> Failing to exercise reasonable care for the safety of its passengers and in doing so 
<line: 22> creating a dangerous condition on the aforementioned water slide on the 
<line: 23> “Ecstasy”; 
<line: 24> b. 
<line: 25> Failing to provide adequately trained individuals at the slide to monitor and 
<line: 26> regulate its activity; 
<line: 27> c. 
<line: 28> Failing to ensure that there was adequate water pressure that was sufficient to 
<line: 29> allow passengers to safely complete the length of the water slide; 
<line: 30> d. 
<line: 31> Failing to follow its own written safety procedures, protocols, rules, and policies 
<line: 32> designed to protect its passengers, by allowing untrained or improperly trained 
<line: 33> individuals oversee the use of the aforementioned water slide; 
<line: 34> e. 
<line: 35> Allowing a dangerous condition to exist notwithstanding prior similar injury 
<line: 36> incidents on this and other vessels in its fleet and this class in the subject; 
<line: 37> f. 
<line: 38> Failing to train crew members in the assessment, inspection, and discovery of 
<line: 39> dangerous conditions that can arise on a water slide when said equipment is 
<line: 40> improperly operated; 
<line: 41> g. 
<line: 42> Failing to comply with its own internal policies and procedures established by the 
<line: 43> International Safety Management Code (“ISM”), Safety and Quality Management 
<line: 44> System (“SQMS”), and other internal operation procedures required by the ISM 
<line: 45> Code, Safety of Life at Sea (“SOLAS”), and all applicable health, building and 
<line: 46> safety codes and ordinances in accordance with 33 CFR 96.100 et. Seq., 46 USC 
<line: 47> §3201 et. seq. and all Rules and Regulations, including, but not limited to all 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:17-cv-22184-KMM   Document 1   Entered on FLSD Docket 06/09/2017   Page 4 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 4> relevant standards Navigation and Vessel Inspection Circulars (“NVIC”) for the 
<line: 5> United States Coast Guard and International Maritime Organization. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 13. 
<line: 8> Defendant’s negligence proximately caused Plaintiff great bodily harm in that, but for  
<line: 9> Defendant’s negligence, Plaintiff’s injuries would not have occurred. 

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 14. 
<line: 12> Defendant either (a) had actual knowledge of the dangerous conditions; (b) had 
<line: 13> constructive knowledge of the dangerous conditions; (c) would have had knowledge of the 
<line: 14> dangerous conditions had the Defendant implemented proper methods of inspection; and/or (d) 
<line: 15> created the dangerous conditions. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 15. 
<line: 18> As a result of the Defendant’s negligence, Plaintiff has suffered severe bodily injury 
<line: 19> resulting in pain and suffering, disability, disfigurement, mental anguish, loss of capacity for the 
<line: 20> enjoyment of life, expense of hospitalization, medical and nursing care and treatment, loss of 
<line: 21> earnings, and loss of ability to earn money. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 16. 
<line: 24> Plaintiff has suffered these losses in the past and will continue to suffer such losses in the  
<line: 25> future. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> WHEREFORE, Plaintiff respectfully requests that this Court find in her favor and grant 
<line: 28> judgment, interest, and costs against Defendant, and any such other relief to which the Plaintiff 
<line: 29> may be justly entitled. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> Respectfully submitted, 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> /s/ Juan A. Fernandez-Barquin                  
<line: 34> JUAN A. FERNANDEZ-BARQUIN, P.A.  
<line: 35> (FL. BAR NO. 055811)

<line: 37> Miami, Florida 33135

<line: 40> E-mail: juan@jafblaw.com 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> Date: June 9, 2017

<line: 4> JURY REQUEST 

[TEXT]
<line: 6> Plaintiff, by and through counsel, hereby requests a trial by jury in the above-captioned matter. 

[TEXT]
